channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Grass seed required, 17th November
item.description:
When the workers were putting in a new pathway and lights they dug up the grass that belongs to Bromley Palace Park. They have spread grass seed on their land, but have neglected to spread grass seeds at the side of the path which is in Bromley Palace Park. Please can this be rectified. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: E-bike dumped over a year causing obstruction, 17th November
item.description:
This has been chained up here over a year. Causing obstruction. Someone has moved it along the wall now after it keeps being knocked down. Other household waste , furniture , mattresses etc being dumped near it too. Why is it taking so long to be removed (?)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Overhill Road, East Dulwich, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass, 17th November
item.description:
There is what appears to be many broken empty glass milk bottles all over the pavement and into the road on the corner of Long Lane and Belvedere Road junction just up from London Blind Company and the garage door shop. St thomas moore school is close also.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 207, Belvedere Road, Barnehurst, Bexleyheath, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Maitland Park Villas, 17th November
item.description:
There are significant road defects on Maitland Park Villas. The road surface and pavement have risen sharply around the access cover, creating a pronounced bump and an uneven surface. This presents a genuine risk of injury to pedestrians and cyclists, and may also cause damage to vehicles. It is particularly hazardous for cyclists travelling at night. This issue requires urgent attention. Please investigate and repair the damaged section of road and restore a level surface as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Maitland Park Villas, Chalk Farm, Hampstead, London Borough of Camden
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Datchelor Place is for pedestrians only. No Lime or Forest. They will be moved, 17th November
item.description:
Lime moved to end of road. Tyres look very flat. Stop your customers from leaving the bikes on this street

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 51, Camberwell Church Street, Camberwell, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Maitland Park Rd — Carriageway, 17th November
item.description:
There’s some serious road faults on Maitland Park Rd. The road surface has raised significantly around the access cover in the middle of the carriageway, it’s creating a sharp bump that isn’t easily visible when approaching. This poses a real risk of damage to vehicles and is especially dangerous for cyclists, particularly at night. This needs urgent attention. Please investigate and repair the damaged section of road and level the surface as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Maitland Park Villas, Chalk Farm, Hampstead, London Borough of Camden
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: King Henry’s Road near the Marriott Hotel, 17th November
item.description:
There’s a serious road fault outside 151 King Henry’s Road, heading westbound, just as you approach the bend near the Marriott Hotel. The road surface has collapsed around the access cover in the middle of the carriageway, creating a sharp bump that isn’t easily visible when approaching. This poses a real risk of damage to vehicles and is especially dangerous for cyclists, particularly when traffic is busy or at night. This needs urgent attention. Please investigate and repair the damaged section of road and level the surface as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 155, King Henry's Road, Belsize Park, Camden Town, London Borough of Camden
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: At the bus stop, 17th November
item.description:
A lot of leaves and litter too at the bus stop, including behind it and to the left and right. The bus stops in Willesden lane should be cleaned every week by default. But they are not. This one (and the one opposite) have not been cleaned for two weeks and are only done if I report them on FixMy Street which I didn't do last week; so they weren't done So; please could you ask the Veolia team manager to 1: Ask the guys to clean this bus stop of litter and leaves 2: Please make sure that the bus stops in Willesden lane are done every week so I don't have to keep reporting it Many thanks Kind regards Steve Collins

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Willesden Lane, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet
